sentences.sentence: The Frog( 青蛙 ) Prince( 王子 )
In the old times, when it was still useful to wish for what one wanted, there lived a king with three beautiful daughters.
The youngest was so beautiful that even the sun itself, which has seen so much, was astonished( 吃惊的 ) whenever it shone on her face.
Near the King’s castle( 城堡 ) lay a great dark forest, and under an old tree in the forest was a well( 井 ).
Whenever the day was very warm, the King’s daughter used to go into the forest and sit down by the side of the well where it was cool,
and if she was feeling bored, she would take a golden ball, and throw it up and catch it again.
This ball was her favorite toy.
One time, the princess’s golden ball did not fall into her hand, but onto the ground, and then rolled( 滚 ) straight into the water.
The King’s daughter followed it with her eyes, but it vanished( 消失 ), and the well was deep—so deep that the bottom could not be seen.
Then she began to cry, and cried louder and louder( 越来越大声 ), and could not be comforted.
And as she was crying someone said to her, “What’s wrong, King’s daughter?
You seem so sad that even a stone would show pity.”
She looked round to the direction that the voice had come from, and saw a frog stretching( 伸出 ) its thick, ugly head out of the water.
“Ah! Old water-splasher, is it you?” said she.
“I am crying for my golden ball, which has fallen into the well.”
“Be quiet, and do not cry,” answered the frog.
“I can help you, but what will you give me if I bring your toy back up again?”
“Whatever you want, dear frog,” said she, “my clothes, my pearls( 珍珠 ) and jewels( 宝石 ), and even the golden crown( 皇冠 ) which I am wearing.”
The frog answered, “I do not want your clothes, your pearls and jewels, or your golden crown.
But if you will love me and let me be your companion( 伙伴 ) and friend,
and sit by you at your little table, and eat off your little golden plate( 盘子 ), and drink out of your little cup, and sleep in your little bed—
if you will promise me this, I will go down below, and return your golden ball to you.”
“Oh yes,” said she, “I promise you all you wish, if you will only bring me my ball back again.”
But she thought, “What silly things the frog says! He lives in the water with other frogs—how could he be anybody’s friend?”
But when she had promised, the frog put his head into the water and dived( 跳水 ) down.
In a short while came up again with the ball in his mouth, and threw it on the grass.
The King’s daughter was delighted( 高兴的 ) to see her pretty toy once more, and picked it up, and ran away with it.
“Wait, wait,” said the frog.
“Take me with you. I can’t run like you can.”
But what good did it do him to scream( 大声叫喊 ) his croak( 呱呱地叫 ), croak, after her, as loudly as he could?
She did not listen, but ran home.
Soon she forgot the poor frog, who was forced to return to his well.

The next day when she had seated herself at table with the King and all the courtiers( 侍从 ), and was eating from her little golden plate, something came creeping( 缓慢行进的 ) splish splash( 水花飞溅 ), splish splash, up the marble( 大理石 ) staircase( 台阶 ).
When it had got to the top, it knocked at the door and cried, “Princess( 公主 ), youngest princess, open the door for me.”
She ran to see who was outside, but when she opened the door, the frog was sitting in front of it.
Then she quickly slammed( 砰地关上 ) the door and sat down to dinner again, very frightened( 害怕的 ).
The King saw how frightened she was, and said, “My child, what are you so afraid of? Is there a giant( 巨人 ) outside who wants to carry you away?”
“Ah, no,” replied she. “It is no giant, but a horrible( 讨厌的 ), ugly frog.”
“What does a frog want with you?”
“Dear father, yesterday as I was in the forest sitting by the well, playing, my golden ball fell into the water. And because I cried so, the frog brought it out again for me.
Then, because he insisted( 坚持 ), I promised him that he should be my companion. I never thought he would be able to come out of his well!
And now he is outside there, and wants to come in to me.”

article_info.previous: 侏儒怪第三次帮女孩解围，但是这次女孩身上已经没有什么东西可以给侏儒怪了，只得答应侏儒怪以她成为王后生下的第一个孩子作为交换。孩子出生后，侏儒怪前来索要。王后惊恐万分，苦苦乞求，侏儒怪动了恻隐之心，承诺如果王后可以说出他的名字，他便不会带走孩子。最后王后悄悄地跟踪侏儒怪偷听到了他的名字，侏儒怪又惊又气，掉进一个巨大的裂缝里。
article_info.share_words: In the old times, when it was still useful to wish for what one wanted, there lived a king with three beautiful daughters.

question.cn: 小公主最喜爱的玩具是什么？
question.en: What was the youngest princess’s favorite toy?

analysis: 文中提到：“And if she was feeling bored, she would take a golden ball, and throw it up and catch it again. This ball was her favorite toy.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 青蛙想要什么作为回报？
question.en: What did the frog want as a reward?

options.en: He wanted to be the princess’s companion.

analysis: 文中提到：“The frog answered, ‘I do not want your clothes, your pearls and jewels, or your golden crown. But if you will love me and let me be your companion and friend,. . . —if you will promise me this, I will go down below, and return your golden ball to you.’”青蛙不想要任何物质回报，因此答案选C。

question.cn: 当公主打开门看到是青蛙时有何感受？
question.en: How was the princess when she opened the door and saw the frog?

analysis: 文中提到：“She ran to see who was outside, but when she opened the door, the frog was sitting in front of it. Then she quickly slammed the door and sat down to dinner again, very frightened.”因此答案选B。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第78天
